Testing MOD and Integer Division
=================================

Test 1: Basic MOD
10 MOD 3 = 1 (expected: 1)
17 MOD 5 = 2 (expected: 2)
20 MOD 4 = 0 (expected: 0)

Test 2: MOD with negatives
-10 MOD 3 = 2 
10 MOD -3 =-2 
-10 MOD -3 =-1 

Test 3: Integer division (\)
10 \ 3 =3(expected: 3)
17 \ 5 =3(expected: 3)
20 \ 4 =5(expected: 5)
25 \ 7 =3(expected: 3)

Test 4: Integer div vs regular div
10 / 3 = 3.3333333333333335 (regular)
10 \ 3 =3(integer)
15 / 4 = 3.75 (regular)
15 \ 4 =3(integer)

Test 5: Integer div with negatives
-10 \ 3 =-4
10 \ -3 =-4
-10 \ -3 =3

Test 6: MOD in expressions
 100 MOD 7 = 2 
Result * 2 = 4 

Test 7: Integer div in expressions
 50 \ 8 =6
Result + 1 = 7 

Test 8: Even/odd with MOD
 1 O 2 E 3 O 4 E 5 O 6 E 7 O 8 E 9 O 10 E

Test 9: Combined MOD and \
 47 \ 10 =4(tens digit)
 47 MOD 10 = 7 (ones digit)

Test 10: Precedence (MOD before +)
10 + 7 MOD 3 = 11 (expected: 11)
10 + 5 \ 2 = 12 (expected: 12)

MOD and integer division tests complete!
